line_1: And the spread Mint along the Window climbs:
line_2: Yet the rub'd Chest and Table sweetly shines,

line_1: To the high throne of sense soft slumber climbs,
line_2: Slackens their sinews, and benumbs their limbs;

line_1: Whilst here the Vine o'er Hills of Ruin climbs,
line_2: Industrious to conceal great Bourbon's Crimes.

line_1: The foolish Creature thinks he climbs:
line_2: Mov'd in the Orb, pleas'd with the Chimes,

line_1: Swift up her pendant Web Arachne climbs,
line_2: While he scarce trails along his tortur'd Limbs;

line_1: Where the fierce Rat (all dreadful) never climbs,
line_2: Nor the sleek Mouse sad Foe to Mira's Rhymes.

line_1: When Pride by guilt to greatness climbs,
line_2: Here let me learn to shun the crimes
